page.title: 04A Typical Day in Woodhalls
page.content: A typical day in the farming community can be seen from the point of view of the farmer or farmer's wife.The farmer spends his day attending to the stock in the pens,inspecting sheep and other livestock in the fields and,on a dairy farm,milking the cows.During the day routine maintenance of buildings, machinery, fences, hedges and gates is carried out with weekly trips to the livestock market at Hatherleigh to sell and buy stock and meet other farmers.Other seasonal tasks include hay and silage making, combining, ploughing and shearing. The farmer's wife spends much time doing household chores,preparing meals and cooking;most are not active in farm-work but help as required.Some tend poultry and much time is spent cultivating the kitchen garden.
